author: lzybkr
body:
- [ ] Resolves issue #abcd.
- [x] Code is [rebased](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/git/README.md#sync-your-local-repo) on `origin/master`.
- [ ] Add tests that fail without your changes.
- [ ] Update all relevant [documentation](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/tree/master/docs).

I ran the https://github.com/dotnet/codeformatter on most of our code.  I'll squash these commits - the full project doesn't actually build on all variants with some of the intermediate commits.

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: 👍 for following the CoreCLR coding style standards.  What's the plan for maintaining the code to these standards?  We've been using https://github.com/DotNetAnalyzers/StyleCopAnalyzers but there are some issues using this with .NET Core - https://github.com/DotNetAnalyzers/StyleCopAnalyzers/issues/2160

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body:
Rejecting formatting changes, periodic formatting, see:
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blame/master/docs/dev-process/coding-guidelines.md#L8

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @lzybkr do you want the commit author under your name or PowerShell Team? Keep in mind Git blame.

comments.author: vors
comments.body: I would suggest use PowerShell team as an author. Or you can create another entity just for periodic formatting commits.

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: @vors said merge it, so I'm merging.
